newsitem.title: UK: NWE oil products mostly $2 down, fuel trades at $7.
newsitem.headline: NWE oil products mostly $2 down, fuel trades at $7.

text.p: NWE oil products were mostly steady after dropping $2 a tonne soon after the open on Tuesday.
Gasoline talked $208.50 a tonne by late morning, a shade up from opening levels but buying interest was thin. Swaps were pegged around $207.50 for June and $202 for July.
Gas oil barge premiums held stable at $1 a tonne above the IPE which was down $2 at $175.75 on June at 1048 GMT.
Heavy fuel traded at $78 and was reported to have been done as low as $77 but June talked above $80 with Antwerp supplies asking $81.50.
